docs.description: An in-depth guide on the CSS 'display' property, detailing its syntax, usage, and various display values for web layout.
This resource explains the CSS transition property, detailing how to create smooth transitions between styles on web elements.
An overview of the CSS `filter` property, detailing its syntax, usage, and effects on visual elements.

notes.description: A comprehensive guide to understanding key concepts and applications in discrete mathematics.
This resource offers comprehensive tutorials on various topics in engineering mathematics.
An explanation of the Pigeonhole Principle in discrete mathematics, including its applications and examples.
A concise set of last-minute revision notes covering key concepts in discrete mathematics.
An overview of functions in discrete mathematics, covering definitions, types, and properties.

quiz.question: What is the contrapositive of the statement 'If it rains, then the ground is wet'?
options: If the ground is not wet, then it does not rain.
If the ground is wet, then it rains.
If it rains, then the ground is not wet.
If it does not rain, the ground is wet.
quiz.hint: The contrapositive of 'If P, then Q' is 'If not Q, then not P'.

quiz.question: Which of the following represents the union of sets A and B?
options: The set of elements that are in either A or B or both.
The set of elements that are in both A and B.
The set of elements that are only in A.
The set of elements that are only in B.
quiz.hint: Union combines all elements from both sets without duplication.

quiz.question: What is a bijective function?
options: A function that is both injective and surjective.
A function that is only injective.
A function that is only surjective.
A function that is neither injective nor surjective.
quiz.hint: A bijective function is also known as a one-to-one correspondence.

quiz.question: How many ways can you arrange the letters in the word 'DISCRETE'?
quiz.hint: Use the formula for permutations of a multiset where some items are repeated.

quiz.question: In probability, what is the complement of an event A?
options: The event that A does not occur.
The event that A and another event B occur together.
The event that neither A nor any other event occurs.
quiz.hint: The complement of an event is when the event does not happen.
